entry.et: Middle English cappe, from Old English cæppe, from Late Latin cappa head covering, cloak

def.dt: :a head covering especially with a visor and no brim
:a distinctive head covering emblematic of a position or office: as
:a cardinal's biretta
:mortarboard
:a natural cover or top: as
:an overlying rock layer that is usually hard to penetrate
:pileus
:calyptra
:the top of a bird's head or a patch of distinctively colored feathers in this area
:something that serves as a cover or protection especially for a tip, knob, or end a bottle cap
:a fitting for closing the end of a tube (as a water pipe or electric conduit)
:cervical cap
:an artificial crown for a tooth
:an overlaying or covering structure
:a paper or metal container holding an explosive charge (as for a toy pistol)
:an upper limit (as on expenditures) :ceiling
:the symbol ∩ indicating the intersection of two sets compare cup 9
:a cluster of molecules or chemical groups bound to one end or a region of a cell, virus, or molecule
:in a respectful, humble, or sometimes fearful manner
:to provide or protect with a cap
:to give a cap to as a symbol of honor, rank, or achievement
:to form a cap over :crown the mountains were capped with mist John Buchan
:to follow with something more noticeable or more significant :outdo
:to bring to a climax or conclusion cap off the show with a song
:to form a chemical cap on
:to prevent from growing or spreading :set an upper limit on cap oil prices
:to supply (a tooth) with an artificial crown
:to form or produce a chemical cap
:a small amount of an illegal or legally regulated drug
:a small amount of a drug enclosed in a capsule
:capitalization 1d
Civil Air Patrol
combat air patrol
capacity
capital
capitalize; capitalized

entry.et: Middle French (de) cap a pé from head to foot

def.dt: :from head to foot armed cap–a–pie for battle
:a very short sleeve (as on a dress) that hangs over the edge of the shoulder without extending along the underside of the arm
cape SE France SW of Antibes
cape NW France at tip of Cotentin Peninsula
